column1: Sudden Recurrence/Intensity of Rapid Regular Heartbeats
column2: nwflapoke, 55-64 Male  on Treatment for 5 to less than 10 years (Patient)
column9: I have been on this drug, first 50mg 2x a day and now up to 150mg 2 x day for 3 yrs. In addition I take Toprol once a day. As the strength has increase so has the instances of dizziness and some nausea on occasion. But it has been mostly effective in controlling sudden rapid heartbeat. I would say that  it has controlled it 80-85 percent of the time. I am not sure I can ever get rid of it 100% so I will take this. I have this electrically problem for a decade or more but the medical community just stared controlling on me in the last 5-6 years. As anyone who has it knows when the heart takes off it is very uncomfortable and scary.

column2: Kenneth , 25-34 Male  on Treatment for 6 months to less than 1 year (Patient)

column2: energizer bunny, 75 or over Female  on Treatment for 1 to less than 2 years
column9: I'm 78, had AFib for a year+, 2 failed ablations and 1 failed cardioversion and many changes in meds. I went on Flecainide about two weeks ago and my pulse rate remained high until 3 days ago. That evening I passed out on the couch beside my husband. Even since that episode both my blood presssure and pulse rate have been at my lifelong low normal. Today I passed out again and hit the floor while working in the kitchen. So far, myelectro-cardiologist has given no explanation.Flecainide is the only change in meds or life that my husband and I can determine. Flecainide good? bad?

column2: Book Lady, 55-64 Female  on Treatment for 10 years or more (Patient)
column9: I have had A-Fib for over 20 years. In my case it started with infrequent episodes once or twice a year but episodes have increased frequency as the years went by. Finally I began having them frequently and they would last for days. Recently had a 6-hour ablation but went into AFib again before I even left the hospital. It was distressing! After 2 weeks finally got the heart back in rhythm with Flecainide, Toprol XL and Atacand. Unfortunately now on Coumadin for a few months. The Ablation (6 hours) went well but the anaesthesia made me extremely anxious which lasted for several days. MOST IMPORTANT--find an experienced ELECTROPHYSIOLOGIST (a cardiologist who specializes in heart arrythmias) to work with your regular cardiologist. If he/she doesn't listen to you--find someone else who will. Side effects with Flecainide: tiredness, blurry vision, occasional breathlessness, hair thinning--not exactly a girl's dream. But the Flecainide has been better than anything else to keep the heart in rhythm. Pradaxa was awful; I had to get off of it within a week due to how much it upset my stomach. Read all you can on any drug you are asked to take and if you have a problem--tell the doctor.

column2: lakelifelady, 65-74 Female  on Treatment for less than 1 month (Patient)
column9: Went on 75mg X2 daily along with Digoxin .125.Stopped metoprolol 50mg all at once and had attacks off and on for a day and five major that night. Went back on Metoprolol, decreasing dosage every two days which helped. Experience some constipation, headache and alot of ringing in my ears. Trouble concentrating. Exercise tolerance has improved though. Aches and pains.

column9: I was diagnoes 10 yrs ago with Atrial Tachacardia, was put on Toprol which worked fine until last Feb. Because of this I was started on Flecainide the next day in the hospital. Started with 50 mg 2x a day and within 2 months moved up to 75mg 2x a day. At my 6 mos check the EKG showed my heart rhythym to be 100...way over my normal 65. I'm currently waiting to hear from the doctor to determine what next.

column2: della street, 55-64 Female  (Patient)
column9: I had undiagnosed AFib far too long before a heart attack 4 years 11 months ago.  In the treatment following the heart attack, I was put on Flecainide among a medicine chest of other drugs: Metoprolol 150x2; Plavix, Lipitor, Altace, Lasix and Protonix.  We started at 50x2 a day.  The episodes were less frequent, then started up again to the point I woke up during the night in soaking wet with sweat and 160+ heart rate.  So we increased to 100x2 a year ago.  I even went 3 months without a single flutter.  But when they came back, they now are 4-5 times a week and last for hours.  So last week, cardiologist changed dosage to 150x2 and has referred me to a Cardiac Electrophysiologist with ablation in mind.  I will continue to research treatments and new meds and adjust my meds before I have an ablation.

I have gone back on the brand name and it has been almost a month and my heart beat is getting back to normal.  Just hope they continue to manufacture the brand name.

column2: winlou, 55-64 Female  on Treatment for less than 1 month (Patient)
column9: Diagnosed with paroxysmal atrial fibrillation with about 7 episodes ranging from 4-15 hours each this last year.  Have been on Lopressor for last 4 years which didn't seem to help much over this last year so cardiologist added Flecainide Acetate, and directed that hospital stay was not required because of the low dose and I should take it on an outpatient basis.  Performed baseline EKG which was normal.  I then took this med in morning and at night, about 12 hours apart, for one week and had many side effects from left chest and shoulder pain, jaw pain, feeling strangulation in sides of neck, hard to breathe, lethargy, etc.  After the 3rd day I was ready to go to emergency, because I physically felt so bad, but "hung in there."  Subsequently, the symptoms seemed to lessen, however, the intermittent chest discomfort remained.  Little did I know that this med was having very negative effects on my heart.  Had follow-up cardiology appointment one week later with follow-up EKG.  Thankfully, my subsequent EKG returned to normal after one week off this medication.  Now, my doctor has prescribed another drug, on an outpatient basis also, even though the manufacturer states that it should be given while in the hospital, and I have serious reservations.

column2: Pacemaker, 35-44 Male  on Treatment for 1 to less than 2 years (Patient)
column9: Started taking Flecainide almost 2 years ago,I am 37 and have a pacemaker.Started having problems over 10 years ago.Until one moring I work up with my heart going crazy.Had an ablation done and it came with a free pacemaker.I had a coupon.But I still had problems with afib.I was not symptomatic it just drove me crazy,and I was on blood thinners.I would go into a bad spat of a fib about once a month,one time I was in it for 96 hours.Ya go me!.Anyway they put me on this drug and have been good ever since, no afib for almost 2 years.The only side affect is some trembling in arms and sometimes my legs,I did know about the side affects until after I got them then I read about it.And no more blood thinners,so it does work I take 100mg twice a day,50mg of atenenol once a day and 325mg of aspin.Other than that I am good.I do what I want and are very active,when I was in afib I was always able to do what I wanted.It never stopped me and I felt fine besides that my heart would beat at 190bpm when I was sitting.What I dont understand is why I know so many people around my age who have heart issues,I know at least 8-9 other people with problems...they gave out a bad batch of hearts 30+ years ago....anyway the drug work take it just dont let it sit in your mouth to long before you swallow its really bitter

column9: Although I have fewer long bouts I still deal with weekly short attacks. 15 to 60 secs. sometimes less sometimes more. I am 41 years old taking 50m twice a day.

column2: Brian J., 25-34 Male  on Treatment for 1 to less than 2 years (Patient)
column9: I'm on 50mg of Flecainide and have been taking it for about 1.5yrs. I am currently 27yrs old and started on it about a month before my 26th birthday. Have suffered from side effects ranging from blurry vision and constipation to trouble sleeping and  trouble getting up in the mornings after I finally do fall asleep. I feel exhausted during the middle of the day and completely drained around 7pm or so. Blurred vision and trouble focusing are the main side-effects I feel.The drug does stop the A-Fib but if you miss one dose, you feel the A-Fib coming back and takes a day or two of taking it exactly when you're supposed to take it to rid the feeling of A-Fib coming back. I do feel some symptoms of A-Fib around the 10-11hr mark after taking it though, mainly shortness of breath.

column2: 35-44 Male  on Treatment for 2 to less than 5 years (Patient)
column9: Have had PVC's for 2 years and tried to control with Beta Blockers, Calcium Channel Blockers, and a combination of both with no relief. First took 50mgs twicw a day with no relief then increased to 100mgs twice a day and it was like day and night. After 2 years on this dose and 50mg once a day of Atenalol, still have relief of symptoms.

I have been on Flecainide for nearly month and have had no episodes at all. This drug has been wonderful for me. The only side effect I have noticed is blurred vision... its bothersome for about an hour or so after taking the drug and then goes away.

column9: After 3 months, have suffered w/post nasal drip, constant coughing, swollen eyes.  Have been treated for 2 wks for allergies. No good results. I feel it may be this medication. Am also on Lipitor, and Diltiazem for blood pressure. Any way to compare to others on this web site?

column2: Bobo, 45-54 Male  on Treatment for 1 to 6 months (Patient)
column9: I have had A-fib for over 30 years on an irregular basis. I averaged one episode a year until June of 2006. That is when I started having A-fib 3 times a week on average. My Cardiologist has tried many drugs to control it. Finally in September he put me on Flecainide 50mg twice a day and I haven't had a sustainable episode since. I can feel my heart wanting to start A-fib, but it goes back into normal rythym immediately. I do feel that at my next appointment we will probably try 100mg twice a day because I feel the A-fib coming on more often towards my next dosage, usually 9-10 hours after taking the dosage in the morning.  As far as side effects go, I really can't attribute anything to Flecainide. I will say that I have had very vivid dreams since taking it, but I really enjoy that,so it is a harmful side effect if at all. All in all,if you have A-fib,I highly recommend Flecainide. It has been the only drug that has worked for me. A-fib is a pian in the butt,especially when you are around people that don't understand. I avoid that conversation with everyone I can. I keep my friends informed, but everyone else is on a need to know basis.

column2: cindy, 45-54 Female  on Treatment for less than 1 month (Patient)
column9: I have had premature ventricular contractions.  I started taking 50mg twice a day after trying numerous other meds first.  It decreased them to half so we have increased to 100mg twice a day and my PVCs are gone unfortunately I am nauseous, sleepy and have blurred vision.  Will see if that improves before changing.  It is wonderful not to have the PVCs!

column2: jds, 55-64 Male  on Treatment for 5 to less than 10 years (Patient)
column9: after taking far too long to id the a-fib, finally was put on 50mg 2x day. worked for a short while but episodes recurred. was increased to 100mg 2x day and have had few episodes over last 5 years. seems that the body adjusts to the dose amd must be increased over time. I will NOT go through any surgery as long as I can control the condition with this drug. I don't know of any side effects I can attribute to this med. I take a generic form of the medicine. Can't skip any doses or I get into trouble.

column2: southofboston, 45-54 Male  on Treatment for 5 to less than 10 years (Patient)
column9: I take this drug, 150 mg 2x a day, along with atenolol, 25 mg 2x a day,81 mg aspirin. I just had a cardiac ablation, recovering quickly, 3rd day, up and doing some errands, no heavy lifting or extreme activities, or I can feel it at the entry site's.Less than 24 hrs after having the ablation, I went into an a-fib episode, that was close to being one of the worst ones I ever had. I had to go back on all these meds, plus increase my asprin dosage to 325 mg, and now I get to take 5 mg cummadin, and worry about the side effects of that med.But, yeah, vision problems, dizzines, fatigue, and now after reading these posts I can probably attribute the ringing in my ears to these meds as well.I am scheduled to go to Dr. in 1 month, he's gonna get an ear full if I cant get off these pills after going thru the ordeal of the ablation, I was under for 6 hrs, I dont know where they get off telling you it's 40 minute procedure and you are up and running in a day or two. Make sure you get all the facts before you sign up for an ablation, I was told it was going to be the 6 hrs so that was no surprise. The surprise was the violent a-fib episode with-in one hour of being home.I have had this infliction for over 10 yrs, I may go back to a med called rythmol or other heart rate/rythm meds.

column2: 55-64 Male  on Treatment for 5 to less than 10 years (Patient)
column9: After experiencing fast, irregular heartbeat events, especially at night, I finally located a cardiologist known as a CARDIAC ELECTROPHYSIOLOGIST who used a so-called "Holter Monitor" to successfully diagnose my problem as chronic atrial fibrillation. He prescribed Flecainide 100mg every 12 hours. It is an effective medication. Symptoms have totally disappeared since first starting Flecainide. However, the prescribed dosage resulted in vision side effects (difficulty focusing) that I found uncomfortable. I was, through experimentation, able to find that one 100mg dose at bedtime was effective in eliminating symptoms AND minimizing visual side effects. My doctor concurred with my decision to only take one per day. I also take 2 blood pressure-controlling drugs. A triumph of modern medicine through effective pharmacology.

Maybe that had something to contribute to my condition.
